name: Istaroth
desc: Ruler of Time, also known as Tokoyo Ookami, "the thousand winds of time," and Kairos, "the ruler of the unchanging world." She is one of the shades of the Primordial One.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>July 9, 2025</color>
"I had to find some way to pass the time, did I not?"

customize.name: Shades
customize.desc: Four Shades created by the Primordial One.

customize.text: Istaroth is one of the four shades created by

customize.name: Primordial One
customize.desc: The First Descender, who defeated seven Dragon Sovereigns of the world and created people. The Primordial One may be Phanes.

customize.text:
Istaroth was the only one who didn't leave the people of Byakuyakoku when they fell into the Dark Sea. According to a legend, the sage Abrax created
with Istaroth's guidance.

customize.name: Makoto
customize.desc: Raiden Ei's twin sister and the previous Electro Archon, also known as Baal. She died during the Cataclysm 500 years ago.

customize.text: Istaroth presumably helped Raiden Makoto to plant the Sacred Sakura seed.

customize.name: Twin
customize.desc: The Traveler's twin, Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah, Savior, and the Princess/Prince of the Abyss Order.

customize.text: The Ruler of Time is likely behind the time anomaly that caused the Traveler and Princess/Prince of Khaenri'ah to meet during the

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.text: . 500 years ago, the twin met a girl, Direidyth, who told them that their brother/sister was looking for them and showed them the key to the hibernation chamber as proof. As a result, the twin abandoned Khaenri'ah during the Cataclysm and went to save their brother/sister, who had not yet woken up. Due to the time anomaly, Direidyth and the Princess/Prince's brother/sister met after 500 years, and they gave the girl the key from the future to the past.

The Thousand Winds Temple, where ancient people worshipped Time and Wind, is located in Mondstadt. Tokoyo Oomikami is the personification of the "undying wind," and the current Anemo Archon, Barbatos, is one of the Thousand Winds.

customize.name: Lost Prayer to the Sacred Winds
customize.desc: An educational tome written by anonymous early inhabitants who worshiped the wind. It has been blessed by the wind for its faithfulness and influence over the millennia.

customize.name: Sacrificial Sword
customize.desc: A ceremonial sword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Greatsword
customize.desc: A ceremonial greatsword that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Fragments
customize.desc: A weathered script, the text of which is no longer legible. A cursed item eroded by the winds of time.

customize.name: Sacrificial Bow
customize.desc: A ceremonial hunting bow that has become petrified over time. The trinkets on it are still visible. It grants the wielder the power to withstand the winds of time.

desc.text:
The words on this sundial seem to follow on from the one by the Thousand Winds Temple. Taken together, the four lines then deliver the complete message.
This place and the Thousand Winds Temple must have something to do with a god of Time.
How ironic that the ravages of "Time" have devoured all trace of the god who supposedly presided over it...
Also — the literature says that some ancient thinkers believed the Anemo Archon to have some sort of connection with this god...
If that's true, there must be some evidence of that here somewhere... Generally, that would be in the form of <color=#37ffff>elemental</color> evidence...
Also, it definitely feels particularly strange around here at a certain time of the day. Starts around 2 AM, and is over by 5 AM at the latest...
There is this sundial here, after all, and in the early hours of the day, <color=#37ffff>the blade's shadow falls directly downwards</color> . It's quite striking, which is why it stands out in my memory.
But I'm no <color=#37ffff>Vision</color> holder. So while I can tell that something's up and theorize about what the cause might be, there's no way for me to investigate it properly.
Honestly, these days... trying to be an academic when you don't have a <color=#37ffff>Vision</color> , it's really restricting...
